windows.symptom: Unable to Identify how Office Applications were uninstalled        We have installed Office Applications in our Terminal Server which runs Microsoft Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard version 6.3.9600 Build 9600. For some reason, suddenly the Office Applications got uninstalled. When I checked the event logs, it says user is system. I checked the security event logs and no one was logged in at the same time when the Office Applications were uninstalled.How can it be uinstalled by itself/automatically? Need help.
solutions: Your question is beyond the scope of these ForumsThis Community is mainly for home users and their computer problems, not business systems.Kindly post your question in the TechNet Server Forums.http://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/windowsserver/en-US/home?category=windowsserverTechNet Forums: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/homeMSDN Forums:https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/homeCheers.

windows.symptom: my product key is damaged        How do I verify the missing digits?
solutions: You could use a torch and magnifying glass to attempt to read it.Or take a photo of it and enlarge it on the screen.If it had been a Retail License, you could use Product Key Finder Programs if Windows 7 is installed and Activated:http://www.belarc.com/free_download.htmlhttps://www.magicaljellybean.com/keyfinder/_______________________________________But if Windows 7 came preinstalled (Dell, HP, etc), read this as above will not work to find a useable Product Key, as Key Finder Programs used on preinstalled Operating Systems only find the Manufacturer's Product Key which was used on multiple machines during manufacture:And if you never received a Recovery Disk when you received your Laptop/computer there should be a Recovery Partition on the Hard Drive to reinstall Windows back to how it was when new.Here are the Key/s to press at Boot to start the Recovery Process back to Factory Settings (new condition). Under each Manufacturer in the list below are the instructions in the respective links for you to follow on how to use their Recovery PartitionAcer – Press Left Alt + F10 Keys.http://acer.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2631Advent – Tap F10 until Starting System Recovery appearshttps://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20081221054701AAJT8YVAsus – Press F9http://support.asus.com/Troubleshooting/detail.aspx?SLanguage=en&m=X53E&os=&no=1775Dell – Press F8 which will bring up Advanced Boot Options                      http://www.dell.com/support/troubleshooting/us/en/19/KCS/KcsArticles/ArticleView?docid=DSN_362066eMachines: Press Left Alt Key + F10http://techchannel.radioshack.com/emachines-system-recovery-1747.htmlFujitsu – Press F8https://forum.ts.fujitsu.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=64&t=39428http://support.ts.fujitsu.com/WDB/FAQContentstart.asp?ID=233412526&WDBStatID=&INFO=SA&quest=&Sprache=en&SprachID=&SecID=&lng=COM&Todo=FAQGateway: Press Alt + F10 Keys - As Acer owns them: press Left Alt + F10 Keys as per Acer eRecoveryhttp://www.ehow.com/how_6960920_restore-computer-using-recovery-partitiion.htmlHP – Press F11 repeatedlyHP PCs - Performing an HP System Recovery (Windows 7) | HP ...Lenovo – Press F11http://support.lenovo.com/en_US/detail.page?LegacyDocID=MIGR-4M7HWZLG – Press F11https://answers.yahoo.com/question/index?qid=20090304161820AAiyvMnPackard Bell: Press and hold the ALT key while pressing repeatedly the F10 key. Release the keys when a message displays that Windows is loading files.http://packard-bell-scandic.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/3068/session/L2F2LzEvdGltZS8xNDA2MjgyMjczL3NpZC90Z205SDktbA%3D%3D/~/use-packard-bell-recovery-management-to-restore-your-system-or-create-recoverySamsung – Press F4http://www.samsung.com/us/support/howtoguide/N0000137/6375/93514Sony Vaio – Tap F10 until the Edit Boot Options screen is displayedhttps://ca.en.kb.sony.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/35585/p/48903,49902,71663,71664/c/65,67/kw/recovery%20using%20f10Toshiba – Press 0 (zero) How To: Perform system recovery - Windows 7And if you do have a Manufacturer's Recovery Partition on your Hard Drive and you can Boot into Windows, you should be able to make your own Recovery Disks from it to reinstall the Operating System in case of Hard Drive failure.Look under Programs > your Computer Manufacturer's name > then their System Tools or Recovery Software Headings for them, depending how it is worded.If you can not find any reference to it, contact the Manufacturer for advice on how to make those Recovery Disks.The above reinstallation methods do not normally require you to supply a Product Key during the Installation Process as the Manufacturers Recovery Process uses the Factory Installation Product Key to automatically Activate during the reinstallation process.Cheers.

windows.symptom: Trying to connect ms wireless all-in-one keyboard to nano transceiver v2.0.  Cannot get to connect.        Trying to connect ms wireless all-in-one keyboard to nano transceiver v2.0.  Cannot get to connect.Thanks!
solutions: Hi Darnell. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.See if any of these help to get it paired and connected: https://www.microsoft.com/accessories/en-us/d/a...https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/838398...https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/hub/4338553...I'll give all possible steps for troubleshooting Bluetooth in order of priority, so even if you've tried them please do it over in sequence. Many problems right now are being solved by updating to the latest version so if you want to skip to that step see the Repair Install at bottom: Try Updating the Bluetooth driver from the PC maker's Support Downloads webpage for your exact model. Install it even if it's the same or newer than the one in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start button.Right click Start button to access Device Manager, locate Bluetooth device (if necessary from View tab Show Hidden Devices), on Driver tab see if Roll Back is available, if not try Update Driver, first automatically, then Browse, then Let Me Pick to try all previously installed Drivers. If these fail Uninstall the Driver, restart PC to reinstall. If the BT driver is not there, access the View tab in Device Manager to "Show Hidden Devices."Make sure you're pairing correctly as shown here: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/15290/... See Fixes here which are all working: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/14169/...https://superuser.com/questions/1017867/make-wi...https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/for...https://www.lifewire.com/fix-windows-10-bluetoo...Try the Bluetooth troubleshooter at Settings > Update & Security > Troubleshoot. Try turning off Fast Startup at Settings > System > Power & Sleep > Additional Power Settings > Choose what Power buttons do > Change settings that are unavailable > uncheck Fast Startup.If this is a mic or headset right click Volume icon in System Tray to Open Sound Settings, make sure the correct device is selected for input or output in the dropdown menu.Then try pairing again, if necessary run the Bluetooth Troubleshooter again. If this was caused by a Version Update then for 10 days you can roll it back in Settings>Update & Security>Recovery and then hide it until it matures using the Hide Updates Tool which is explained more here:https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta....If you think the BT adapter has failed, you can replace it easily with a USB nano adapter like this one:https://www.amazon.com/ZEXMTE-Bluetooth-Receive... Go over this checklist to make sure the install is set up correctly, optimized for best performance, and any needed repairs get done:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... Start with Step 4 to turn off Startup freeloaders which can conflict and cause issues, then Step 7 to check for infection the most thorough way, then step 10 to check for damaged System Files. Then continue with the other steps to go over your install most thoroughly. If nothing else helps you can run a Repair Install by installing the Media Creation Tool and choosing from it to Upgrade Now. This reinstalls Windows in about an hour while saving your files, apps and most settings, solves many problems while also bringing it up to the latest version 1909 which you need anyway and by the most stable method.http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m.... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: networking        when is microsoft going to readd home networking.i have files i need to move from 1 pc to another
solutions: Go Settings, System, Shared experiences.

Hi MrB. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Windows sharing has been broken ever since they removed Homegroup, causing many to believe this was intentional to push us to OneDrive sharing. More about that option later.I'll give you everything possible to try for file sharing problems so at least something will work. If you need help performing any steps I am standing by here to help:See here for how to share files and printers over network after removal of HomeGroup in Version 1803:https://www.windowscentral.com/how-share-files-...https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/111783-shar...https://www.windowscentral.com/how-access-files...To troubleshoot sharing problems: https://www.lifewire.com/troubleshooting-window...https://windowsunplugged.blog/2018/03/27/networ...https://www.thewindowsclub.com/network-computer...https://superuser.com/questions/1202441/windows...If you cannot get past the password protected sharing prompt: https://www.isunshare.com/windows-10/fix-enter-...https://www.speedguide.net/faq/windows-is-askin...https://www.tenforums.com/network-sharing/61689...If Windows 7 is involved make sure if applicable you have the WIndows Update released to fix Windows 7 sharing issues here:https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft... Test if turning off Controlled Folder access helps: https://www.thewindowsclub.com/controlled-folde... See these additional resources for when a PC does not show up on network: http://woshub.com/network-computers-not-showing...https://www.thewindowsclub.com/network-computer...https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-...You may want to change to sharing via OneDrive: https://www.computerworld.com/article/3256907/m... Go over this checklist to make sure the install is set up correctly, optimized for best performance, and any needed repairs get done:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... Start with Step 4 to turn off Startup freeloaders which can conflict and cause issues, then Step 7 to check for infection the most thorough way, then step 10 to check for damaged System Files, and also Step 16 to test a new Local Admin account. Then continue with the other steps to go over your install most thoroughly. If nothing else works then do a Repair Install, by installing Media Creation Tool, open tool and choose to Upgrade Now. This reinstalls Windows while keeping files, programs and most settings in place, and is also the most stable method to advance to the latest version. http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... If you want to express your opinion on this to Microsoft use the Feedback Hub app in Start Menu where developers are tasked to process consumer feedback. They will not even see it here. This is a tech forums staffed mostly by volunteers trying to help others with your problems. If you want to post back a Share link from your Feedback here others who see this thread can vote it up and add to it.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

When I need to do this I click on the computer I want to transfer files from, I then have to enter the computers name and password. This makes it available for me to transfer the files. See example images below. To be able to transfer files from my Desktop to my new Laptop that I got for Christmas, on my Laptop I clicked on Desktop under Network. I then entered the information and my Desktop was made available. Second image is showing Desktop connected to my Laptop.

windows.symptom: 3D Models from Paint 3D appear weirdly textured and glitchy.        Hello,So, I made a 3D model in Paint 3D on Windows 10 (I have Powerpoint 365). When I saved the Paint 3D model as a glb file, I inserted it into my Powerpoint.  When I did, the texture was very glitchy and checkered. It was nothing like the model on Paint 3D. I tried update my driver to the latest update, but it still is appearing the way it is. What can I do?
solutions: Hi,Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums.We understand your concern as the texture of the model is changing that you are creating in Paint 3D app.In order to get clarity and to assist you accordingly, please reply with the answers to the questions below.What is the Windows 10 version and Build installed? (Type winver in Windows search/Run command)What is the Paint 3D app version currently installed on the PC?Did you try saving the 3D model in a different format? What happens when you open the same 3D model in 3D Viewer or 3D Builder app?Meanwhile, we would like you to reset the Paint 3D app and check if you have the same issue.Press Windows + I key to launch Windows settings.Click on Apps and select Apps & feature from the left pane.Scroll down and select Paint 3D app on the right pane.Click on Advanced option and then click on Reset.Restart the PC and then launch the Paint 3D app.Also try creating a 3D model in 3D builder and then check it on the Office PowerPoint app.We await your response.Aditya RoyMicrosoft Community – Moderator

windows.symptom: Hi I have purchased a new laptop running windows 10 and now messenger plays video with a black screen audio is fine any suggestions?        All drivers are upto date please help find a solution
solutions: Hi CB. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.What messenger? Are you referring to Facebook Messenger? Is this the Windows Store app or are you accessing it in a browser?If it's the store app reset it in Settings > Apps > Apps & Features > Facebook Messenger > Advanced Options > Reset & Repair.If that isn't enough then uninstall it in the same location, restart PC, then reinstall from MS Store app Settings > My Library.If this is in a browser, try another browser. I would have several browsers on your task bar so there's always one that's best for the task. I use Firefox, Edge and Chrome in that order of preference. It's easy to share bookmarks between all of them in their settings under Import Favorites from another Browser, and Firefox and Chrome let you sign in to save and/or sync your Favorites on any other device you sign into. Set the preferred browser as Default in Settings > Apps > Default Apps.Next try resetting your browser: https://www.howtogeek.com/171924/how-to-reset-y...Run this Flash tool in all browsers to make sure it's enabled properly and latest:https://helpx.adobe.com/flash-player.htmlFor Edge follow these extra steps: https://www.digitalcitizen.life/how-unblock-fla... If this isn't your exact problem then please explain more so we dont' waste any more time.______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: I'm trying to use Both the Speakers and the microphone in my bluetooth headphones, but I  can only use one or the other.         here are snips of the playback and recording devices that have shown up for the headphones. I'm not 100% sure on the details you might need if you know the answer, but here's the brand of the headphones: https://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-Over-Ear-Bluetooth-Wireless-Headset/dp/B07LBYLM7B/ref=sr_1_3?keywords=amazonbasics%2Bbluetooth%2Bheadphones&qid=1577239293&s=aht&sr=1-3&th=1and for the bluetooth chip I used: https://www.amazon.com/Plugable-Bluetooth-Adapter-Compatible-Raspberry/dp/B009ZIILLI/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=plugable+bluetooth+usb+adapter&qid=1577239607&s=electronics&sr=1-1for a further explanation on the problem, I've managed to get the speakers to work on bluetooth, the audio is fine. (only when connected to stereo as seen in the playback photo). If I connect it to the second option, It works but the audio quality is extremely poor. problem is, I can only use the mic and speakers if I use the second option on the playback image. I'm trying to use the 1st option and the mic at once, (to talk to friends or play Voice chat compatible video games) but If I use one or the other the other shuts off. for example, when I connected to a discord call my speakers turned off. my friend I was calling could hear me, but my speakers were off. When turning off discord, my headphones turn back on.
solutions: Hi, Thank you for writing to Microsoft Community Forums. We understand your concern as you are having issues with the Bluetooth audio devices that are connected to your PC, seems that the audio quality is poor. In order to get clarity and to assist you accordingly, please reply with the answers to the questions below. What is the Windows 10 version and Build installed? (Typewinver in Windows search/Run command)What is the make and model of the PC? Meanwhile, we would suggest you to refer the step as mentioned inRun the Bluetooth troubleshooter under Things to try first from this article:Fix Bluetooth problems in Windows 10 Also we would suggest you to remove/uninstall driver from device manager.Press Windows + X and select Device Manager.Scroll down and expand Bluetooth. Now Right click on the devices and selectUninstall.Check the box beside “Delete the driver software for this device” and clickOk.Restart the PC and reconnect the devices.Let us know how it goes. Aditya RoyMicrosoft Community – Moderator

windows.symptom: Microsoft Hello will not enter setup for fingerprints        I have a new HP Envy 13 inch laptop.  The fingerprint setup worked fine as part of the initial computer setup, but about a week later the fingerprint stopped logging in so I deleted the old fingerprints in Windows Hello and tried to setup new ones.  However, when I hit the "Get Started" key in the setup of the fingerprint the key disappears and nothing happens.  The only key remaining is the cancel key at that point.  It just sits there doing nothing.  I went ahead and set up a new windows account to test the system and see if it is my user account, but the results were the same on the new account.  This computer is less than a month old and shouldn't be having this issue!  Thanks for any help you can provide.
solutions: Hi Barb. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Do you have a System Restore point to roll back to before the problem began? See here how to do this, which is simple and easiest:https://www.windowscentral.com/how-use-system-r...See fixes for Hello fingerprint here: https://www.technorms.com/43772/troubleshoot-fi...https://pureinfotech.com/fix-windows-hello-fing...https://www.thewindowsclub.com/fingerprint-read...Other fixes here for Windows Hello: https://windows10skill.com/windows-hello-not-wo...1) Turn off Fast Startup: Go to Settings > System > Power & Sleep > Additional Power Settings > Choose what Power buttons do > Change settings that are unavailable > uncheck Fast Startup.2) Reset Facial Recognition and/or Fingerprint Options https://blog.goptg.com/how-to-reset-windows-hel...3) Modify Group Policy Settings (for Pro version only) Updates might have modified some of the crucial settings of Group Policy. Therefore, we would recommend to launch the Group Policy Editor and check/edit the settings related to Windows Hello functionality.Pres Windows key, type gpedit, and press Enter. Click on Computer Configuration and open Administrative Templates. Select Windows Components and open Biometrics. Click on Facial Features and right-click on Configure enhanced anti-spoofing option.Select Edit and disable the Configure enhanced anti-spoofing feature. Reboot your PC. 4) Update drivers If some of the system drivers, most probably webcam and fingerprint reader drivers, were corrupted during the version upgrade process, Windows Hello may fail to perform. To fix that, try to update the corresponding drivers:Right-click on Windows key and select Device Manager. Locate the Hello, webcam, and fingerprint drivers individually and right-click on each of them.Select Remove driver software and wait for the removal to be finished. Repeat the removal with all Windows Hello related drivers and then reboot your PC.Once done, open Device Manager, click Action -> Scan for hardware changes. The system should automatically detect and reinstall the drivers. 5) If this was caused by Windows Updates then you can check which were installed at Settings>Update & Security>Windows Update under Installed Updates, then uninstall them from the link there, and hide with the Hide Updates tool as shown here:https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta... 6) If this was caused by a Version Update then for 10 days you can roll it back in Settings>Update & Security>Recovery and then hide it until it matures using the Hide Updates Tool which is explained more here:https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta....7) Go over this checklist to make sure the install is set up correctly, optimized for best performance, and any needed repairs get done:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki... Start with Step 4 to turn off Startup freeloaders which can conflict and cause issues, then Step 7 to check for infection the most thorough way, then step 10 to check for damaged System Files, and also Step 16 to test a new Local Admin account. Then continue with the other steps to go over your install most thoroughly. 8) Update your drivers and BIOS/UEFI firmware from PC or motherboard maker's Support Downloads web page, using the full model number, Serial Number or Dell Service Tag on sticker. Compare the latest drivers available for download with the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu. Make sure you have the latest BIOS or UEFI firmware, Chipset, Display (Video), Sound, USB3, Bluetooth, Network and all other drivers, or else download and install the latest now.Updating drivers from the Device Manager or Windows Update is rarely enough. The most basic thing we need to learn to maintain a PC is keep the latest manufacturer's drivers installed from their Support Downloads web page.9) If nothing else works then do a Repair Install, by installing Media Creation Tool, open tool and choose to Upgrade Now. This reinstalls Windows while keeping files, programs and most settings in place, and is also the most stable method to advance to the latest version. http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... ________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: Install windows 10 in a brand new auto-build computer from scratch        I want make a new fresh install of Windows 10 in my brand new desktop computer, and I to want keep my license key from the old one computer.It's that possible?
solutions: Hi DJ. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Moving activation to new hardware depends on whether the original license is retail or OEM. This is because retail can always migrate wherever you want, but OEM dies with the first motherboard installed upon. Upgrades inherit these rights and restrictions.If it's retail and it shows a Digital License linked to your MS Account in Settings > Update & Security > Activation, then you can usually transfer the license by signing into the same MS Account on the new hardware, run the Activation Troubleshooter. See if it finds the old hardware and let's you move it to the new. If not you will need the retail key to reactivate via Support, so try inserting it first in Settings > Update & Security > Activation > Change Product Key even if it's the key for the old OS which was Upgraded.If not contact Microsoft Support by one of these phone numbers: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/405170...You can also go here: https://partner.support.services.microsoft.com/... choose the link for Browser help, interact briefly about your exact problem until it connects with an agent.There is more on hardware changes in this Microsoft publication: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/20530/...I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to choose if I solved your problem, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.

windows.symptom: windows 10 mail doesn't accept my pin        I can't log into my default account (the only account) using the windows 10 mail app.  It does not recognize the pin for this account.  My pin works when I log in directly with outlook.  I tried resetting the windows 10 mail app.  This did not resolve the issue.
solutions: Hi Harold, My name is Marc, thanks for participating in the Microsoft Community, I'm an Independent Advisor and I'll be glad to help you today.Check the recommendations of the official Microsoft website that handles this issue that you tell us, and see if you can help solve it.https://support.office.com/en-us/article/change...Let me know if you have something else that I can help you with, I'd be happy to help.Have a nice day Regards, Marc M.

Thank you Marc M.I was able to resolve the problem before I got your reply.  I had to click on "sign in another way".  There, it gave me the option to sign in with my password.  That worked.  I assumed pin and password were the same things.  Obviously, this was not the case.

windows.symptom: Hard Drives        When setting up my computer I put windows onto an ssd so my computer would boot up faster but then later on it ran out of space so now I have a hard drive to use. I tried to download something off of the web and it said it was interrupted. But it was trying to download to my ssd. I went to go change the primary hard drive and it only shows my ssd nothing else but my hard drive is working because I have games from steam on it but it doesn't want to download anything from the web. PLS HELP!!!           thank you
solutions: Hi Ciber. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.I would not move the paging file or apps off an SSD onto a hard drive because it will suffer a speed loss. What can afford to move without any speed loss are your User folders. I will deal with this a bit later.I will give you steps to free up space on smaller drives and when necessary perform version Updates on them manually by the most stable method that requires much less space than Windows Update.First here are tips for managing smaller drives including the 32-gb SSD which they should have never allowed Windows 10 be installed upon:https://www.theguardian.com/technology/askjack/...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3040404/windows...https://www.groovypost.com/howto/maximize-stora...As more space becomes needed, you can move your User folders to another internal hard drive you have or install, or Desktop, Documents and Pictures folders into OneDrive and then set them to On Demand so they reside in the cloud and only have download links on the PC: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/116029-turn...https://www.pcworld.com/article/3233488/windows...You can also offload User folders (Documents, Music, Pictures, etc) to another drive you can install on the same PC (even in the DVD drive bay) as shown in this tutorial, which will not affect speed if C is on an SSD and the other drive is not:https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/1964-move-u.... I would not move program files or speed will be affected. You could also install a larger SSD/HDD.This should make enough space to install Windows Updates. But I'd focus on the latest Version update since successfully installing it will bring along all Windows Updates and also resolves almost all other problems since it reinstalls Windows keeping your files and programs in place. Install the Media Creation Tool on another PC to create bootable media or download the ISO to stick or disk, transfer it back to the target PC to open the media or click to mount the ISO, right click Setup file to Run as Administrator. This avoids needing the space to download the Upgrade and it's staging files. http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/m... Another option is to do the the best possible Clean Install in this link which will stay that way as long as you stick with the tools and methods given, has zero reported problems, and is better than any amount of money could buy:http://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wiki.... This will give you back all but 15gb of the drive. There is also an automated Fresh Start that reinstalls WIndows while shedding corrupting factory bloatware, saves your files, but doesn't clear the drive to get it cleanest:https://www.howtogeek.com/265054/how-to-easily-... I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.
You need to move some of your data off the C:\ drive to the D:\ drive.

windows.symptom: Disable adaptive brightness on win10 Pro - Build 1090        Hello,I'm unable to disable the auto brightness feature of windows 10 on my laptop(Dell 7373). Firstly, I could not find any place that has any settings to enable or disable adaptive brightness but when I use my laptop on battery power this feature appears magically and it hard to work with. Display brightness keeps changing on every user action.I deleted and restored the default power plans in several waysI changed all (all I found, though) corresponding registry entries to disable adaptive brightnessI even stopped the windows service that monitors brightnessPower Settings:Graphics :Display Settings:
solutions: Hi Janak. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.1) See here various ways to disable Adaptive Brightness: https://www.itsupportguides.com/knowledge-base/...2) Update the Display driver from the PC or Display adapter maker's Support Downloads web page for your exact model number, HP Serial Number or Dell Service Tag - from the sticker on the PC.While there check also for newer chipset, BIOS/UEFI firmware (very important), network, sound, USB3 and other drivers, comparing to the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu.If this doesn't give you the latest or ideal driver for what you need, compare it to the driver offered by the Intel driver update Utility here:http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/support/... or the Nvidia Update utility here: http://www.nvidia.com/Download/Scan.aspx?lang=e... or the AMD autodect utility here: http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/windows/P... For Display issues one fix that is working is to Roll back or Uninstall the Driver on the Display Device > Driver tab, restart PC to reinstall driver.You can also try older drivers in Device Manager > Display device > Driver tab > Update Driver > Browse > Let Me Pick.Then you will know you've tried everything in addition to Windows Update drivers.Adjust the screen resolution until it fits and looks best at Settings > System > Display.I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and keep me posted. If you will wait to choose if I solved your problem, I will keep working with you until it's resolved.________________________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

windows.symptom: An error occurred while writing installation information to disk. Check to make sure enough disk space is available and click retry or cancel to end the install        The error occurs during the installation of applications with the extension .msiWhat should I do in this situation?
solutions: How much free space do you have on the C:\ drive?
13 gigabytes
Now days you need 20-30 GB to do the installation.

Hi there My name is Jon and I am an independent technical adviser. Sorry to hear you are experiencing issues and I would really like to help you find a resolution.Is this a 1711 error? Have you checked to see how much free disk space you have available? Right click Start button > File Explorer > Select This PC in left column and check C:\ drive in right hand column.Hope this helps.

windows.symptom: Internet Problems        I got a new motherboard recently and I am able to access chrome and watch videos and stuff but it says i'm not connected to the internet and in turn won't let me activate windows so there is an annoying pop up. All my drivers are up to date and I don't think it is a problem with the computer itself.
solutions: Hi Oliver. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Where does it say you're not connected to the internet? Please post a screenshot so we can see what you're seeing:http://windows.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-10/o.... Attach using Attach Image button in reply box.I'll give you everything for network problems so that at least something will work. Even if you've tried some of these steps already please do them over in sequence to see if it makes as difference:Update your network adapter drivers from the PC maker's Support Downloads web page using the full model number, HP Serial Number or Dell Service Tag on sticker. Compare the latest drivers available for download with the ones presently installed in Device Manager reached by right clicking the Start Menu. Make sure you have the latest BIOS or UEFI firmware, Chipset, Display (Video), Sound, USB3, Bluetooth, Network and all other drivers, or else download and install the latest now.If you have the latest network driver then try on it's Driver tab also to Roll Back, or Uninstall and then restart PC to reinstall the driver. Try also all older drivers from Update Driver > Browse > Let Me Pick list working backwards.If this was caused by Windows Updates then you can check which were installed at Settings>Update & Security>Windows Update under Installed Updates, then uninstall them from the link there, and hide with the Hide Updates tool downloaded from here:https://www.howtogeek.com/223864/how-to-uninsta... You can also use System Restore to get before the problem began, then check for Updates with the Hide Update tool and hide them.If this was caused by Version update then you can roll it back in Settings>Update & Security>Recovery and then hide it until it matures using the Hide Updates Tool.For Wifi won't connect after Version 1903: https://windows101tricks.com/fix-wifi-keeps-dis...https://www.techrepublic.com/article/wi-fi-and-...https://pureinfotech.com/fix-wifi-problems-wind...For Ethernet not working: https://www.kapilarya.com/wifi-ethernet-doesnt-...Go to Device Manager > Network Adapters, select network adapter in use, click on the Power Management tab, clear the check box to "Allow the computer to turn off the device to save energy." Then click on the Advanced tab, disable any energy-saving options.Enable IPv6 in the network adapter settings: https://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/90033-enabl... Run the fixit from https://support.microsoft.com/help/929852 (Re-enable IPv6 on all nontunnel interfaces) and reboot.Right click the network icon in System Tray at bottom right end of task bar to Troubleshoot Problems.Try all of these steps: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/10741/... https://www.thewindowsclub.com/windows-10-netwo...Go to Settings > Network & Internet > WIfi > Manage Known Networks, highlight and remove the network having problems, restart PC to see if it shows up again.Try plugging in by ethernet cable to the router to compare, then plug the ethernet cable into the modem (if separate) to see if this might be an issue with the router.Try powering off modem, router and PC and then restarting in that order with 1 minute in between each. You may need to reset your router or even optimize it following these steps:https://www.lifewire.com/resetting-a-home-netwo...https://www.pcmag.com/article/258865/how-to-set...Your router manual is always available from the manufacturer's website for your exact model.You also are entitled to Support from your internet provider to get online on all devices. This is always included in the monthly bill. If your router is less than a year old they will also Support getting it connected and optimized.Another option is you could replace the wireless adapter with an inexpensive USB nano adapter like this one:https://www.amazon.com/OURLiNK-600Mbps-Wireless...I hope this helps. Feel free to ask back any questions and let us know how it goes. I will keep working with you until it's resolved.______________________________________________ Standard Disclaimer: There are links to non-Microsoft websites. The pages appear to be providing accurate, safe information. Watch out for ads on the sites that may advertise products frequently classified as a PUP (Potentially Unwanted Products). Thoroughly research any product advertised on the sites before you decide to download and install it.

1st edit Internet options,set to default,edit all,in advance tab,locate Reset to Advanced settings button.After,open control-panel/networking/change adapter settings,allow only one to operate/current..After,and if networking software-driver is current,go to macromedia.com/flash player download,once it starts,chrome will be ready to install by default,read the menu,once it starts,exit all but the installation,or it wont run,the rest is auto.Also,open WMP,run the Now Playing utility,R.click on the L.lower corner,edit,  more options,select for upper task bar,advanced options gets you WMP 1st page,locate Connect to the Internet box,edit others.

windows.symptom: Why does Microsoft Security Update KB4523205 causes my CS4 Photoshop to stop working?        Why does Microsoft Security Update KB4523205 causes my CS4 Photoshop to stop working?
solutions: Any 3rd party anti virus, security, cleanup programs EVER installed?
Webroot Secure Anywhere

Go to its site and get their removal software and completely remove it.  Windows Defender and Malwarebytes are all you need with Windows 10..The best security sits between the chair and the keyboard.  Watch what and where you click.  If you do not know what is there do not click on "Click here".  If you get an email that sates it is from your provider look at the address of the sender.  If it has a couple of letters at the end they are probably the foreign country and that is not where your provider is located.  When downloading programs do it from the maker not anyone else and do not allow any extra items to be included.

This does not solve my problem!My problem is that the Microsoft Security Update KB4523205 stops my CS4 Adobe Photoshop ver 11.2.0 from working.After I uninstalled KB4523205 my Photoshop program began to work again.The problem is that I have to uninstall that particular one every damn month!

Sorry to hear you are experiencing issues and I would really like to help you find a resolution.1.Press the Windows Logo Key + R to open the Run dialog box, type wsreset.exe, and then select OK.2.Wait for the process to finish, and restart your computer. windows.symptom: Sign-in Options: Facial Recognition Not Available At All (there is no graying of boxes, it simply doesn't appear)        G'day world, I cannot find the setting to set up facial recognition as a sign-in option and on the top of the page, it says 'some settings are hidden or managed by your organisation'. I find this very strange as other people who also encounter problems involving biometric access don't have access to fingerprint recognition either yet I do. Is there some way to use GPO or the Registry to enable facial recognition? I've also read that there is a way to remove facial recognition by going underneath the Picture Password and clicking 'remove' but is there a way to bring it back?Anyway, that's all. Please ask any questions as I'm not the best at explaining things fully.
solutions: Hi and thanks for reaching out! I'm an Independent Advisor and a Microsoft user like you. Please allow me to assist with your issue.If your computer is joined to a Active Directory Domain (likely for an organization issued computer), you will need to contact the administrator to enable Windows Hello for Business by Group Policy or mobile device management (MDM) policy. If you are the administrator, please find further information here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/securi...Please let me know if I can help you further!
Are you using a preview build from the Windows insider program?

G'day and thanks for the reply,I believe that I am linked to the aforementioned Active Directory Domain. I was wondering if there was a way to change the Group Policy or MDM policy to allow facial recognition as a sign-in option without contacting an administrator.
No I am not.
G'day!Sorry, That is not possible when Windows is linked to an Active Directory Domain. Group Policies or MDM Policies will be enforced.

windows.symptom: Cannot switch out of windows 10 home S mode on a 14" HP AMD 4 GB RAM version 1909        I entered into the Microsoft store and pressed GET..  but it's taking for ever and never making the switch
solutions: Hi Laya. I'm Greg, an installation specialist, 10 year Windows MVP, and Volunteer Moderator here to help you.Make sure you're following this procedure to exit S Mode: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/445606...The issue is likely with activation server overload as Windows 10 approaches a billion users and Microsoft can't build server farms fast enough. So you can try again later.Or you can contact Microsoft Support by one of these phone numbers: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/405170...You can also go here: https://partner.support.services.microsoft.com/... choose the link for Browser help, interact briefly about your exact problem, keep replying agent until it connects with an agent.I hope this helps.
